Title: BEWARE they make you pay for THEIR…
Details:
BEWARE they make you pay for THEIR MISTAKE

I am a long time user of Snap Travel now Super.
However, I just booked a twin room and a glitch on their site meant after I pressed confirm the twin room I tried to book changed to a king before my eyes. I tried to hit the back button to stop it but the booking came back as confirmed and they will not amend it even though it was a glitch on their website. They have asked me to contact the hotel.

I am travelling with a friend and we do not want to share a bed hence me booking a twin.

I am shocked & angry as I can see I am not the only person this has happened to in the last few days.

Beware of using this company because I cannot understand how they can switch your room then say you cannot amend it.

This has absolutely ruined my holiday

Title: Reliable, easy and best price on the Internet
Details:
I found in Google Maps that Super.com offered the best price for a hotel I was looking for, even better than the hotel's official site! Thanks to them I saved more than 100€. What I enjoyed the most, apart from the price, was how the customer journey was perfectly managed. The info on the website was clear, and all the management they did through a verified WhatsApp business account was easy and very convenient. I made the reservation through Super.com website, they sent me a couple of WhatsApp messages with useful info prior the check-in, and all was set up for us the day we arrived at the hotel.

I had a really good experience and for sure I will use Super.com again. The process is easy, convenient, and you get considerably reduced prices.

Title: The only thing about this company I…
Details: The only thing about this company I like is the $ you can save when booking. Other than that won't be using them ever again. Booked 2 hotels with them, both "non refundable" which was a mistake. Booked under my boyfriends name, so I am writing this review for both of us. The 1 hotel we got there and it was not as nice as the pics showed online. We also found something disturbing in our room so we ended up not staying there at all. The hotel was super nice and apologized several times and understood completely why we no longer wanted to stay there. They told my bf to have super reach out to them and they will give them all the info and tell them they approve to refund him. I will never book with super again due to them giving my bf a hard time with the refund and telling him that HE has to reach out to the hotel and tell them to reach out to super via email with all the info and signature of a manager. It should NOT be the customers responsibillity, and makes NO sense why super couldn't just reach out to the hotel themselves. They need to change their ways and policies.  The hotel even agreed and told my bf that that is wrong, makes no sense, and usually the booking website are the ones to reach out to the hotel. So don't recommend using super or ever booking a non refundable hotel at all since they will give you a hard time and want sooo much info just to give you your $ back.

I wouldn't complain so much if it were not 32 degrees and my two year old wasn't with me as we have nowhere to go and no money to book through another site. 

Upon speaking with customer service they told me they apologize yet they recommend I speak to my bank to reconcile the payment issue. 

Even after asking to escalate the call to a supervisor or management and begging for them to step up and make things right I kept getting the same statement about calling the bank. 

Absolutely frustrated and have no clue what to do and I'm stuck in freezing weather with a 2 year old because of this.

Title: Stay away from Inn at Diamond Cove
Details:
October 28, 2023


To Gerard Kiladjian,

I am writing to tell you how extremely disappointed and upset I am about my recent stay at your hotel, Diamond’s Edge. I wanted to plan something special for my husband’s birthday on September 27th, and having stayed at Great Diamond Island as a kid, I thought it would be fun and romantic to stay there for his birthday. I booked this room back in July and requested one of the more expensive rooms with both a balcony and a fireplace, not knowing quite what the weather would be then. I also sent an email to the Diamond’s Edge restaurant to see if I could make a reservation for dinner. This was back in July when I booked the room but got no reply. As the date got closer, I ended up calling and they said the restaurant wasn’t even open due to new fall hours. When I said I needed to cancel then, he said that we could get breakfast, lunch and dinner “up at the lodge”, so I decided to still go. It seems it wouldn’t be a fancy dinner but we could have dinner, so that was ok I thought.

When we arrived at the dock there was no one there to meet us – someone called up to the hotel, but still no show so the bus driver (for the island perhaps) said he would give us a ride after he dropped off someone else.

When we arrived at the room and tried to turn on the fireplace it wasn’t working. This was one of the most important aspects of the room to me. First, we couldn’t even find anywhere to turn it on. Then, when we asked downstairs at the desk, they said someone had to turn it on. So we requested that – though if you purchase a room with a fireplace, I would expect it to be ready for us. .  . However when the kid – yes kid- came to try and fix it – he couldn’t – so no fireplace.

The final straw that broke the camel’s back was dinner. We came down to have dinner and was told the chef had called in sick and there was no food to be had. Are you freaking kidding me? We’re on an island, with nowhere else to get food, paid $250.00 for a room and can’t eat!
This is so unacceptable. A bit later the waiter came over and said, “They had found some frozen pizzas” and we could have that – wow – great and not even comped!

We couldn’t wait to get out of there. Really nice job providing my husband, who works so INCREDIBLY hard, a horrible birthday.

I do know you were closing soon after, but that is no excuse. Every customer should be treated the same and have the same amenities whether it’s the first day of opening or the last. I am appalled that an establishment that boasts about what a wonderful getaway like this would treat their customers this way. I am also from Maine, so you can bet I will be posting some reviews about this unless you refund me my money.

On top of it all we were in such a hurry to make sure we got the first boat out of there that I put my $300.00 Maui Jim sunglasses down for a minute, waiting for the boat, forgot to pick them up and so am now out ANOTHER $300.00. UNBELIEVEABLE!!!

Mary Lou & Dominic

I had a previous booking with the same hotel (refundable and cost $3750- booking 10665459) but had decided to upgrade to a breakfast pacakage so cancelled that and booked again with $3750 credits from the original booking (which I paid with card) and paid $254 extra on my card. I have contacted live chat and customer service twice a day every day and each time I get a different story- bottom line is no one can tell me where my $3750 is or when it will be refunded.  Pay this company at your own risk.


EDIT 31/10/23- I note the reply from Super.com however as of today I still do not have the funds returned either to my bank account or to my PayPal.  So clearly whatever action the supervisor allegedly took has not worked as I still don’t have my money!!

The customer care is shocking, called a country outside the uk to talk someone who really hadn’t got a clue how to deal with the situation. Still waiting for a follow up email to explain why i can’t get a refund. 
I would NOT recommend anybody to use this company even if they offer the best deals on the comparison websites Carmen Mcaree

Details:
I’ve used Super.com many times now for hotel bookings used for both  personal and business travel. I’ve had a great experience to date which is the only reason why I’m giving a 2 star rating, but tonight I experienced unfortunate troubles. I arrived to check in only to find that the hotel didn’t have records of my booking. My 2 night stay is paid for, confirmed and is the correct location and dates, but 90 minutes later I still don’t have a room to check into and Super customer service team hasn’t called me back to handle the situation after having called them three times now for help only to find that no one can help me. Disappointed with this recent experience using Super.com. Not sure if I’ll use them again or not because of this.

Update one week later:  I've been charged for a room that I didn't get due to an outage that happened at hotel during my time of booking. Fortunately, they had one room left, so I purchased it directly from the hotel through a separate booking. But 7 days later, this issue is still not resolved after several attempts by myself, and hotel management to contact Super.com. They have great prices on rooms, but beware if you every have problems like this as they are terrible when it comes to customer service response and support. Super.com responds quickly to Trustpilot reviews, but not to emails or phone calls. Piece of advice: Call your hotel in advance to make sure they have your reservation on file!

I was so happy 🤗.  The hotel was great and the next day I went to write a good review on them and saw that the same room that I was in was $40 more than I paid through Super.com.  thank you so much.

Title: Very low standards, horrible customer service
Details:
I find a room at a certain price advertised as "Free Breakfast". (I even have a screenshot with the details, which I took to send to my partner.)
I complete the reservation and I get the email confirmation and it says "Room only".
The super.com customer representative doesn't even care as "there is a recap in the check out process" where I would have had an opportunity to review the details. (There were practically zero details apart from the name of the room.) 
The dismissive style of the representative and the speed of his responses makes me think this must be happening all the time, he was replying in the chat within a few seconds from me typing, they must have some stock responses exactly for this scenario, they must be doing this all the time.

EDIT: I read your reply, which I find a bit patronising because I know exactly what I booked. Interestingly enough, when I went to the hotel I was informed that breakfast WAS included after all, which is exactly what I had booked. Your confirmation email was wrong, and so was your customer rep that I chatted with, and so was the person who answered this review - which tells me that in reality you have absolutely no idea. You just default to "it's always the customer's fault, bye bye now".
super.com - never again.

Title: I am a first time user of Super.com &…
Details: I am a first time user of Super.com & it exceeded my expectations in ease of use & price.

Details: I was a little skeptical about super.com because I had never heard of them but I decided to go ahead and use it to book my next resort because the price was good and I could use paypal to pay which I trust. Details: Turned up at Chessington Safari Hotel only to find out that my booking was not genuine and they wouldn't honor it. All they could do was match the price, so had to pay for the hotel room twice. This doesn't appear to be a genuine website, so the positive reviews must be fake. Here's my apparently fake booking reference B_11489328 super.com if you're reading. I expect a full refund.

Title: This is absolutely the worst site to…
Details:
This is absolutely the worst site to use for booking a hotel. I was out of town, and decided to stay another night, I used this site because it was cheaper than the others, when I got to the hotel and hour later, they could not find my reservation, so I went to dinner and came back and still not reservation. I had to do a chat online to speak to someone, and they said that it could take hours before my reservation would show up, but they would escalate my situation to the top. Another hour later, nothing. So I went to booking.com and did another reservation, that showed up seconds later at the hotel desk. I finally got someone on the phone, and then they hung up on me, and I have been trying since October 14th to get my money back, and it is now October 20th. They want an invoice from the hotel, but my reservation with them never showed up, so how do they think I can give them an invoice? They took my $150.00, they should be able to put it right back on my account. I do not recommend this company. Stay away.



they are asking for a reply::: my booking number was B_11601721 and i have a total of 8 emails, confirmation # 4181.278.417.... but no help whatsoever

They found me a great room right in the area I wanted and it was at least $20 cheaper than any other website. They used my preferred PayPal payment, sent me an informative email, and kept me updated until my stay but did not send me dozens of email advertisements in the meantime. I had no problems with my reservation and all was as described. Thank You!

Title: Super.com is a scam
Details:
This company made a reservation for me through Kayak.com. Beware!  I paid for the hotel. When I arrived to check in, the hotel said the payment did not go through and I needed to produce another form of payment. Seeing how I was there for my father’s funeral, I had no choice. Now trying to get the charges reversed has been very difficult. I recommend using Hotels.com as it reputable and I have had no issues when using them (Hotels.com)

Update:  After reading my review, they ask for information in order to help, however, no email address, phone number was provided.  Just another technique being used by this company.

Title: Customer service is useless
Details:
During the process of booking, their website crashed and left me no order confirmation or reservation number and yet the payment was already pre authorized. Called and was assured not to worry, my card wasn’t charged and my bank would release the hold in a few days. Two weeks later my money is still on hold and my bank says that Super needs to cancel the transaction in order the release the money. So I again call Super and am continuously asked for a confirmation number which I don’t have. It takes forever to get the agent to understand the situation all while continuously being told the same text book answers. I ask for a supervisor and am told it is “against company policy to have customers speak to a supervisor” then magically it is possible and I should expect a call back from their supervisor. Surprise, I do not get a call back. 
Did this 3 more times over 3 days and to this day haven’t had any solution to my issue. Currently waiting for yet another call back I probably won’t get and don’t know when I will be able to access my money thanks to the incompetence of Super.com

Edit after Super.com comment:

Thank you for the email. I have asked for documentation, like the one now provided via email, multiple times, when I called Super. I was told each time that this was not possible. So I wonder, why all of a sudden it is possible? Why lie to me, clearly it is possible.
Furthermore is there any reason for not calling me back as promised? Was this also a lie?

This could’ve been handled a lot faster if Super would have just sent that documentation the first day that I called customer support. Why did it take a week and a half and a trust pilot review to get this done?

Title: You won’t get a refund if the hotel refunds you
Details:
Don’t book through this company I stayed at the holiday inn in Austin the toilet was blocked no bathroom door etc .. the holiday inn refunded part of the stay to super.Com
, but if you have an issue with the hotel and the hotel refund super.Com they don’t pass the credit on to you , they make it so hard  to request the refund even though I had a credit note from holiday inn they have not provided the refund , they have ignored all my requests , all my emails and even the statement below saying they are looking into
If they have done nothing ! They tell me you to
contact the hotel who tell me super.Com have to refund me! I’ve now got to go through my credit card company too much hassle

Title: Avoid these crooks at all cost
Details:
I would never recommend booking via super.com. This was a huge mistake and cost me not only money but disrupted my holiday plans.

I used super.com to book a hotel in Athens and despite receiving a confirmation from the website the hotel on arrival had no record of my booking. 

I tried calling super.com who only had a US number so this cost me almost £15 to get through to their 'helpline'. I was left for hours waiting late at night in a vulnerable position whilst the usless 'helpline' left me waiting with no update. 

Eventually they called me back to say that their travel partner did not have a solution and I needed to continue waiting or they could refund me. I was assured at the time that I would revieve 5% additional compensation in cash however afterwoods it turns out that this was credit and I was lied too.

I have continually tried getting in contact with super.com as their error and incompetence not only left me in a bad position in athens but also short financially (cost of calling their US only number and the hiked price I had to pay finding an alternative hotel on the same day). They continue to ignore me via email.

Long story short, even if their price seems lower just don't take the risk with these crooks.

Details: I booked a hotel through Super several months in advance at a better rate than I saw anywhere else. I had never heard of Super before, and after reading some negative reviews, I was concerned that I got a deal too good to be true. I waited about 10 days after booking, and contacted the hotel itself. To my relief, they had our reservation and a confirmation number. When we arrived last week, our room was exactly as it was described, and the only thing I had to pay additional was a $10.00 local tax. Based on my experience, I would definitely use Super again. I have absolutely nothing negative, and everything positive to say about my experience.

Title: NEVER will I use this service again!
Details:
NEVER will I use this service again!! Made a hotel reservation using Super.com at 7:30pm as we are driving across the country and we're ready for a good night's rest.  Arrived at the hotel approx 30 minutes later and they hadn't received the booking on their site yet so we were told to either book a room directly with the hotel to access a room.  We would not be able to get a refund from super.com so we opted to wait.  I phoned the super. Com helpline and was disconnected twice!! Finally got through and asked to expedite my reservation and then it magically came through to the hotel. We finally entered our room at 9:30pm.
Once reservation is paid for the confirmation email states it can take several hours hour the hotel to receive the reservation.... this is unacceptable service

Next day - I spoke to a Super customer service rep yesterday, she told me to send an invoice of my hotel payment and call them again. I did so. Was told my case had been elevated and I'd receive a response in 45 minutes. It's 12 hours later and no word. Tired of the hassle.

Title: This site is a hoax and running a…
Details:
This site is a hoax and running a booking scam. I made a reservation a month ago. When I called to check on check in times for my trip, the hotel said they had no reservation under my name or Super.com. Further super.com is not a provider in their portal. Looking online there are many others who have experienced this. I won’t use super.com ever again and plan to file an FTC complaint.

----
Update on this. Super.com provided a canned response and there are more details. On the day the reservation an affiliate of Super.com called "Webbeds" tried to make a reservation at the hotel where Super.com had forgot to book (a month after billing me). The hotel flagged it as fraud and refused the reservation. They shared the number for Webbeds, who I followed up with. Super.com had, without authorization and in an unsecured way, shared both my personal information and my payment information with Webbeds.

Title: While their pricing is decent and…
Details: While their pricing is decent and tempting, their non-refund policy is reprehensible. I was sent from Kayak or Google to them, somewhere along the journey, the dates got mixed, I booked the wrong date, and when I arrived to check-in, there was absolutely nothing I can do to solve the issue. No money back, can't change dates, nothing. I highly recommend people to use more mainstream sites like Priceline etc. Even though they may a few dollars more, you will get adequate help in situations like these. Now I need to go dispute the charge with the CC company. Very frustrating. Imbecile service as well

Title: Highly Recommend
Details: I've used Super a handful of times and it's always amazing and so fast. My buddies and I each booked our own rooms at the same hotel and mine was the cheapest by far with full amenities and options!

Title: Powerless over a faceless organisation
Details: I booked a the Prince Regent Hotel Chigwell for 10 nights at a cost of £996.25. When I arrived the Hotel said they were full and would not honour Super.com's booking and I would receive a full refund. I hastily booked another hotel and contacted Super.com for the refund via the chat and they said the Urgent Care Team would contact me within 24hrs. I have since contacted them 5 times via chat and get the same story. I have also gone back to the hotel and they've confirmed they have taken no money so Super.com have nearly £1000 of my money and can offer no explanation of when Ior if I will get it back. They are faceless and I am powerless with no UK registered address or phone. Avoid them at all costs!!!!! Update: They have now made a refund but why did it take 3 weeks and why was I not kept updated on what was happening or able to speak with the person dealing with the claim?

Title: Online booking gone bad
Details: Made an online reservation for a night (oct 12 to oct 13) from the airport, got to the hotel and the reservation wasn’t there, I waited 5 hours (still waiting)! I talked to an agent from super.com and he told me that an urgent care team was going to contact me but it’s been more than 5 hours and I never got the call or email, they charged me for the room on my debit card. And no one has been able to help me, so I paid the amount, didn’t get the room and even if I do I would have to check out in a couple hours, I’m very disappointed at super.com I feel scammed and frustrated

I arrived to the hotel and tried to make check in. The hotel told me that they had no reservations under my name. Title: I love it very easy to use and the cash…
Details: I love it very easy to use and the cash back is instant and comes in handy

Title: Extremely Deceptive and Unhelpful Experience with Super.com
Details:
I have recently had the most disappointing and frustrating experience with Super.com. My interaction with this company has been characterized by extreme deception and a complete lack of assistance when I encountered an issue with a hotel booking through their "Super Booking Application."

I made a reservation for the Ibis Doha hotel (B_11553815) for the dates of October 12th and 13th. However, the confirmation I received indicated entirely different dates - October 19th and 20th. This is not only misleading but could be seen as outright fraudulent.

Despite immediately reaching out to their customer service department to address this significant discrepancy, my experience went from bad to worse. Super.com's automated services proved to be completely unhelpful, refusing to correct the glaring mistake. Even when confronted with an issue that was clearly caused by their platform, they insisted on not assisting or making any effort to rectify the situation. 

This level of unresponsiveness and lack of accountability is simply unacceptable, especially when dealing with an issue that could impact someone's travel plans and financial well-being. 

What's more, when it became evident that Super.com would do whatever it takes to avoid any contact and refuse to solve any issues that might arise, I took the initiative to report the transaction as fraud to my bank. The lack of response from Super.com left me with no other viable option to protect my interests and financial well-being.

This level of unresponsiveness, coupled with their failure to take responsibility for their errors and misleading information, is simply unacceptable. It is an affront to customer trust and confidence.

I would strongly advise anyone considering using Super.com to think twice. My experience has been a complete letdown, and I cannot emphasize enough how important it is to be cautious when relying on their services. Their inability or unwillingness to rectify mistakes of this nature is a red flag, and their commitment to customer satisfaction is, at best, questionable.

In sum, my experience with Super.com has been marred by deception, a complete lack of assistance, and a failure to take responsibility for a glaring error on their part. I urge anyone considering their services to proceed with extreme caution, as my experience has left me highly dissatisfied and disappointed.

Title: It was not a scam
Details: It was not a scam. I booked my room and confirmed it online. I traveled that and checked in they were ready and waiting for me . Check in was fast and even had a great room for me. It was everything they said it would be. I look forward to my next booking.

Title: Misleading prices with tax not included
Details: Maybe not a scam but definitely misleading. I looked to book a hotel and the price was NOT as advertised - "taxes and fees" were added on top. No other reputable booking website does this.

Title: First time I used this company and will…
Details:
First time I used this company and will never ever use them again

I booked a hotel through them and when I arrived the hotel had no record of my booking or the payment.  I therefore had to pay again. I was able to find an email address to ask for a refund but I only got one response. I was asked to send another email with my reference number and the email address I used for the booking. I did this and in doing so attached the confirmation I got from super.  However, still no response, despite 3 chasers. 

This means I have lost £290 which I do not think I will ever get back. It looks like the same thing has happened to a number of people, even over the last couple of months.  Absolutely appalling.

Title: Appalling customer service
Details:
We booked a hotel through super travel. The hotel air conditioning leaked into the room all night and they could not move us. My young children and both adults were unable to sleep all night. The hotel were happy to issue a refund, but as we booked through super travel stated that we need to get the money back through them. They closed my case without refunding the money, stating that the hotel should, which they refused. The telephone number does not work. Appalling service.

Edit - I submitted my email address and booking number as requested by Super.com. After some time I received an email telling me that the booking was non-refundable, but asking me to get a letter from the hotel and then resubmit a ticket. The hotel have themselves tried to get in contact with super.com on my behalf. I would advise anyone not to book with this company. It is probably fine if nothing goes wrong - but if it does their customer service is truly terrible.

Details: I always make the booking through this site. No issues until I cancelled the fully refundable booking. I made the 2 fully refundable bookings and cancelled it within half an hour. Title: Paid for a room that they didnt book + no help from customer service
Details: We found a good price at a Hotel in Nashville which made it possible for us to travel all the way from Sweden to the US to attend our friends wedding. After 20 hours of travelling it turns out that super.com had not reserved the room at the Hotel that we already had paid for, and the hotel was fully booked! The customer service in the chat was terrible, 3 times they promised to get back to us in 20 minutes but nothing happend. After our 20 hour trip we had to wait 2 hours without getting any help from them. Being on the other side of the world in a new city, awake for 22 hours we at least expected them to book something else for us because we already paid, but no help at all. After 2 hours we had to give up waiting to get some sleep before the wedding and book something ourselves. The cheapest price we could found was 3 times more than what we already paid for and way over our budget! we can not afford it and had to put savings in to cover our Hotel cost but had no other alternative. We just feel sad and scammed about this whole situation and got our trip ruined.

Title: User-friendly website with great…
Details: User-friendly website with great prices.!!

Title: Super.com worked smoothly for me
Details: Super.com worked smoothly for me! I read some kind of bad reviews after I used it so I waited two days then called the hotel directly to verify the reservation and they had it! When arrived checked in no problem. Got a very good deal! Try it! I will use them again.

Title: It's Surprisingly Easy To Book!
Details: It's surprisingly easy to book on Super.com I've used plenty of sites to find the best rates but this one is very straight forward with none of the up-selling distractions just click your date click the room options and click reserve.

Title: A very “super.com” experienced!
Details:
A very “super.com” experienced!! 

I had to book a last-minute hotel for my partner and his friends in Leeds due to an emergency. I looked around for the closest in the city centre and the cheapest hotel with 24-hour check-in. I managed to find one on booking.com. I happened to type the hotel name on Google search, and various websites and prices came up for the hotel. One of the websites was “super.com”, and wow! I was stunned by the price. I decided to check it out. I was dubious at first as I had never heard of it before, so I had to check it out on Trustpilot to see if it was genuine. I saw that it was, so I booked and never regretted it. The booking was quick and easy. I then rang the hotel to make sure the booking went through, and it did. 
I had never expected to pay the price I have for something so last minute and so close to the city centre so thank you “super.com” I’ll be using you again! 😊 

Stephanie

Title: Worse customer service possible
Details:
If you ever need customer service about your booking or need help from them - beware! Worse customer service and they will blame you even if the problem is them. Stay away or go with other better reputable customer care companies. Take everything they say with a pinch of salt. Do not go for a deal purely on cheap value cos when things go wrong you will end up paying a lot more like I did. Stay away from them and seek other companies. Saving some money is not worth the hassle stress and time dealing with such a poor company!!
1. I had website issues with adding enhanced protection a. Website wouldn't accept my amex when selected the option or wouldn't let me check out when I use normal bank. If unselected the option it let me check out with normal bank card. I needed enhance protection due to mental health issues but didn't want to lose my booking. Title: Super.com booked us the wrong room
Details:
I booked with super.com today for a stay tonight.
I booked a room with 2 double beds.
We got to the hotel after 9 pm -  30 minutes after hitting a moose on the highway - so shaken up.  The hotel gave us a room with 1 queen bed.  We didn't notice until we entered the room.  The hotel said it was a booking error on the part of Super. Com and we would have to sort it out through them. 
So I called super.com.  They said they would send a ticket to their urgent care Center and they would contact the hotel and then call us back within 20 minutes.  2 hours later they had still not called.  I called back and they informed me that because we accepted the room and didn't wait in the lobby for them to call us back (for 2+ hours) that they would not be able to get us the room we had booked.  
The people I spoke to on the phone were very kind and polite but their ability to efficiently manage a booking error that they made was pathetic at best . 
First and last time I will ever book through them .

They basically did nothing so now I have put my credit card payment on hold and reported them for fraud. They are fraudulently selling hotel rooms and then putting you in a different hotel. Title: We lost $90, Super.com is a scam
Details:
It works until suddenly it doesn’t. One night we booked a room through them and the hotel didn’t receive the reservation. We were left on the streets without a room at 11pm. We tried contacting Super.com for a refund, they promised that a “urgent care team” will contact us in 20 minutes. We waited in the lobby for 1 hour and didn’t hear from them, agent in the chat stopped responding as well.

Update: an agent called us 7 hours later (at 6:45 AM) and then sent an email, confirming the problem and demanding that we go BACK to the hotel and have US get a WRITTEN letter FROM THE HOTEL on why we were not checked in. Otherwise no refund. We obviously were elsewhere by that time, and Super.com’s demands were strange at least. They would not respond to our follow up emails.

Super.com scammed us and now we are working with the bank on returning our payment.

Title: Beware of Deceptive Online Practices
Details: This company did something I found to be deceptive and very frustrating.  While travelling, I stopped to book a motel at my next stop.  Super dot com had a reasonable rate for the room I needed.  I typed in the data, and proceeded to the payment page.  Without any notice, the booking shifted my stay date two days forward.  So without my knowledge, I paid for a room I couldn't use!  Super didn't allow for any changes after I paid, saying the item was non-refundable.  I made a mistake and didn't see the change in dates.  I feel it is important for such a booking arrangement to warn customers when anything changes from booking to payment, before allowing payment.  Why?  Because without warning -- how are we to expect anything has changed?  This was underhanded business, and I will tell everyone I know that "Super" is not super.  They're a scam, and I ended up paying more than $170 for a room I wasn't able to use.  The hotel (Holiday Inn) refused to intervene, saying they had nothing to do with the booking.  On the website, there's no contact information, and the only way I got back to the company to "chat" online with a representative was when I got back home, and he said he couldn't do anything.  Too bad, so sad, huh?  OK then.  I say stay away from "Super dot com."

Title: Booked a room at Mesa Verde Farview…
Details:
Booked a room at Mesa Verde Farview Lodge. I wasn’t exactly careful to consider which website I was using. 

Shortly thereafter, I visited the actual hotel website to book a tour and realized their pricing was $180 vs the $220 so I asked the hotel to cancel the booking, which, to be fair, was there and seemed to be in order. I was advised the reservation would be cancelled. This all happened within an hour. 

I received ZERO confirmation from Super or anyone else. When the charge came on my credit card, there was no Merchant name. Just said “reservation Farview.

Farview tried to be helpful, but they were unable to tell me who I had booked with and said they were never paid. 

The credit card company offered a brief refund after I disputed the charge, but subsequently recharged me and provided some vague documentation on the company and the charges. 

Due to an airline cancellation, this trip NEVER happened, leaving me with a hotel bill, $40 more than it should have been, with no recourse, despite the fact they assured me they cancelled my reservation. That may be why they didn’t get paid either. 

Upon research, many sites have mentioned that unless you are 100% sure you are going and have looked at other booking options. I agree wholeheartedly. 

They also mentioned Steph Curry is involved with this venture. BOO. I used to like him. 

BEWARE!!!

Title: Terrible customer support and problems…
Details:
Terrible customer support and problems with the website completing bookings. I was trying to book a hotel stay for an upcoming visit to South Africa, but the booking kept failing to complete. I double checked all my card info and it was correct. So then I changed to PayPal Credit instead, which only requires me to login to PayPal, but the booking still failed to complete. Then I thought perhaps it was a problem with my current location, and maybe Super.com doesn't allow bookings from people located in Mexico (I'm a U.S. citizen with a U.S. bank and U.S. address, but I was in Mexico while attempting this booking). So I turned on my VPN and tried again. That actually caused the site to not even attempt the booking. It just did nothing at all. So then I turned off my VPN and remote accessed my VPS, which is located in the U.S. and tried from that machine. But even there, with a U.S. IP address and no VPN, I still got the same "Booking incomplete" message.

So at this point, I started a support chat with a live agent. The agent (Hannah Mae) simply wanted to give me cookie cutter responses that she would copy/paste into the chat, without actually reading my messages that described all the things I'd tried. Eventually, she ran out of copy/paste responses, and then told me there's nothing they can do. When I asked to speak with a supervisor, she told me there was no point, because the supervisor would only tell me the same things. When I insisted, she simply ended the chat and I was presented with a survey of my experience.

I will definitely not be doing business with Super.com again.

I tried to reach super.com but got a robo-text reply. I called the hotel but they didn't even have my reservation in their system yet. Title: They booked wrong dates with no support
Details:
I recently had a terrible experience booking with super.com. I had reserved a room at the Super 8 in Maine for September 25th-26th, but when I arrived, I was informed I had no reservation due to an error on super.com's end. 

I immediately contacted their customer support, but they were wholly unhelpful. Despite the mistake clearly being on their end, they refused to refund my money or change the reservation dates, leaving me with nowhere to stay after a long 14 hour drive. 

The customer service was abysmal. The super.com representatives did not apologize and made no effort to rectify their mistake. I was forced to pay for a new hotel room out of my own pocket, adding unnecessary stress and cost to my trip.

I will never book with super.com again after this experience. Their error left me stranded, and their terrible customer service refused to provide any refund or compensation for their mistake. I would caution all travelers to avoid using this company, as you could end up in the same situation I was with no reservation and no way to get your money back. For a site that claims to make travel easier, they made my hotel stay infinitely more difficult.

Title: Incredibly bad company , should be banned from selling hotel rooms
Details:
They are a disgrace of a company . 
Six weeks before I travelled I contacted the hotel to confirm the details of the booking I made via Super . They told me the booking they had was for a lower grade of room and without the club room access for which we had paid .
I contacted Super and let them know the issue,  they said it would be passed to their amendment team to correct.
I followed up after 2 weeks without an update to be told the we are working on it .
As the holiday got closer I followed up more regularly but always the same answer , I realised it's a copy and paste reply that every chat agent used .
With a week to go I even tried phoning the help line at international call rates , soon realised they could only give the same answer as the chat agents.
When I arrived at the Hotel my booking was still incorrect and missing the extras I paid for , I hoped as I was now contacting super from the hotel they would actually escalate my call and deal with the issue , they didnt , the support / chat agents that provide the 24/7 support have absolutely no power to do anything other than forward messages . I contacted them everyday of my stay and evertime the answer was really sorry we are dealing with it , even after I checked out it was the same answer .
I have escalated it myself to their corporate email address,  the only reply I got was an auto reply after 5 days to apologise for the delay and they would get back to me in the next 5 days , they didnt .
I have paid super money for a product I didnt receive and it is impossible to get any support at all. I have made over 50 attempts using online chat , telephone support and via 2 email addresses. 
They have had 10 weeks from my first contact and have done nothing,  they may not be a scam and you may get lucky with your booking,  if not be prepared to be ignored as you will get zero support.
Update , the response from super.com just proves how inept they are , they have had 4 months to resolve this issue and I never had any reply,  I was forced to go through my card provider and now they say they that's the reason they can no longer communicate directly,  truth is they would never have responded and going to my card issuer was the only option I had, will update review after card issuer gets their response

Title: Super never booked hotel. Do not biokm with them
Details:
I booked a hotel in Atlanta over Labor Day weekend about a month in advance through Super. The rate I got seemed almost too good to be true, and indeed it was. I read mixed reviews but the negative ones were where Super never booked the hotel. To try and avoid it, I contacted the hotel to make sure my booking was confirmed a couple weeks out. The hotel didn’t have any record of my booking so I contacted Super who assured me they had made the booking and it was the fault of the hotel who hadn’t put it in their system. They told me they’d follow up just to be sure. Days goes by, nothing. It was coming up on a week out and the end of the refundable cancellation period so I checked with the hotel again and still same thing so followed up with Super. They assured me this time they’d have it handled that night and I’d get a call, that never came. I ended up making a separate reservation directly through the hotel just in case because I didn’t want to get to the hotel and not have a reservation. That’s exactly what would’ve happened if I hadn’t done this though, despite Super lying and assuring me several times, when I arrived at the hotel they had no record of my reservation through Super and the hotel was fully booked. Super did nothing to help remedy the situation and it was 10 pm by the time I got to the hotel, so I would’ve been without accommodations late at night if I had not booked a safety reservation, at 3x the rate I got through Super.  Will never book through them again and I’d advise against anyone else from doing so.

I did end up getting a refund from Super unlike many others, however I still ended up paying much more for the hotel then I would’ve if I booked directly through them, on a different 3rd party site, or at a similar hotel in the area when I booked a month out instead of my last minute booking where rates were much higher. So still came out at a loss but did rightfully get a refund.

Title: Promised refund and denied 2 months later
Details:
On 5/12/23, I booked 2 nights (June 9-June 11, 2023) hotel at Canopy By Hilton
Charlotte Southpark via Super Travel (booking B_9427087) and prepaid the full amount
of $406.92. My mother had a stroke on 6/7/23 and I traveled from NC to MD to be with
her. On 6/8/23 I contacted Super Travel and requested to cancel and be refunded. On
6/8/23 I also called the hotel directly and explained my situation and requested a
refund. The hotel was very accommodating and said I could absolutely cancel my
reservation. They also told me that SuperTravel was difficult to work with and if they
denied my request for a refund to tell them verbatim: "I understand your following your
policy but may I please speak to your supervisor. Please send me an email notification
confirming a full refund and any penalty will be waived. If they say hotel won't cancel
"How can I get a credit so I can rebook thru you?" On 6/8/23 I received the following
email from SuperTravel: "Hi Jessica, I am Mari from SuperTravel. I am reaching out
because the hotel contacted us to let us know that they have approved a FOC
Cancellation for your booking on 09 Jun 2023. We just want to confirm that you would
like to cancel this booking." I responded via email on 6/8/23 and confirmed the
cancellation. I heard nothing further from SuperTravel nor did I receive a credit. On
BOTH 6/27/23 and 7/11/23, I emailed SuperTravel: "Please advise when I will be
refunded $406.92. Thanks" On 7/23/23 I received the following email from
SuperTravel: "Hi Jessica, It's Maria here from Super Travel. I am following up on your
ticket for booking B_9427087. Unfortunately our travel partners denied confirmation
for the free of charge cancellation and so we will not be able to process a refund. We
understand this may not be the outcome you expected and want to reassure we did
our best. Thank you for understanding." I called, online chat, and emailed SuperTravel
numerous times requesting a refund and they have refused.

Title: Terrible, dishonest communication and extortionate charges
Details:
*UPDATE 5th October*
I have received the below reply from customer service, which quite clearly does not address my complaint at all. I stayed in the hotel 2months ago so why would I now be trying to change or cancel the booking.

SuperTravel HelpDesk
4:56 AM (5 hours ago)
to me

Hi there,

I'm saddened to hear that you would like to cancel your booking. Please be advised that I've reviewed the policy on this booking, and it's non-refundable and non-amendable. Unfortunately, this means that we are unable to make any changes to your booking, and a cancellation will not result in a refund. Please note that this was communicated on the booking form, and later on the confirmation page. Thank you for understanding.
-------------------------------------------------------------
My original review:

While Super.com may initially catch your eye with their competitive hotel booking prices, my experience with their customer service has been nothing short of disappointing, disorganised, and, most significantly, exorbitantly costly.

I found myself with a problem when my friend and I mistakenly booked hotel accommodations for the wrong dates. With our travel date fast approaching, we knew we needed to rectify the situation as swiftly as possible. Super.com offered a glimmer of hope, stating that, for an administrative fee and pending the hotel's approval, they could attempt to amend our reservation. We were told that their amendments team would liaise with the hotel on our behalf.

However, this is where the ordeal began. For an entire week, we received no updates, despite sending follow-up emails. Frustrated and running out of time, I decided to call the customer service team using the phone number displayed on the Super.com website. Little did I know that this call would cost me a whopping £555 ($689), a fee that was never disclosed beforehand. During those excruciating days leading up to our trip, I made a total of nine phone calls to Super.com, mostly spent waiting on hold or in a queue.

To make matters worse, it turned out that no one from Super.com had actually contacted the hotel on our behalf, as they had claimed in their email and on the phone. I personally reached out to the hotel, only to find out that they had no record of Super.com's communication. This blatant misrepresentation of their efforts left us bewildered and frustrated.

After numerous phone calls and conflicting information, we received an email from customer services stating that they could not amend our booking, even with the hotel's approval. Instead, they suggested that we contact the hotel ourselves to request a refund and then obtain written approval to send back to Super.com. This was a stark contradiction to the information we had initially received. Exhausted from the runaround and time constraints, we had no choice but to change our plans and book new flights to accommodate the existing reservation.

To our surprise, shortly after our decision, we received yet another email from a different Super.com representative claiming that they were diligently working with the hotel to change our dates and were awaiting a call back from the hotel. This sudden change in stance only added to our confusion and frustration.

While Super.com's customer service can be reached via email, their response times are painfully slow, rendering meaningful communication nearly impossible, especially when time-sensitive travel plans are involved. Moreover, the misinformation they provided about their communication with the hotel demonstrated a lack of honesty in assisting us.

While we acknowledge our initial mistake, it was Super.com's initial assurance that they could assist us (for a fee) that led us to persist in seeking their help. The eventual revelation that they couldn't provide the service they had promised was not only immensely frustrating but also costly, as evidenced by my shockingly high phone bill.

I have submitted this complaint to Super.com, and despite more than a week passing, including a follow-up email, I have yet to receive any response from them regarding this matter. I am also exploring my consumer rights regarding the undisclosed call charges incurred.

I remain open to discussing this matter with Super.com if they respond to my emails

UPDATE: despite providing super.com with my details as they requested in their reply below I have still not been contacted by them or received a reply to my emails.

Title: Dont let the cheaper prices deceive you.
Details:
Booking ref - B_8353052

This website looks to be the most attractive as it gives the lowest prices… but please do not go near them.

Stayed and travelled to a hotel to celebrate an occasion with my girlfriend, believing I had got a really great deal compared to other websites only to arrive on to said hotel and the room was not the same room I booked on the website. We were given 2 single beds in a room which was buried in the corner of the hotel underneath a building site. 

Upon going down to reception the hotel manager had told me the hotel is now booked out so he can not move us to our proper room - but he did say that our travel agency changed our room 24 hrs before arrival and that this was not their responsibility.

Fast forward a few months and with a written letter from the hotel I stayed in approving a refund (which was requested by SuperTravel), customer services are still messing around with me. I was told that this would take a maximum of 30 days to be resolved but now fast forward 60+ days and regular check-ins with their customer service, I am either getting no response by their ”Amendment Team” or the same robot automated response via their online webchat to “keep an eye out in my emails” and wait for an update. I think they are hoping I eventually give up on this and let things slide, not happening.

I have screenshots and record of the room I stayed in, and customer services embarrassingly contradicting themselves each time they speak to me, please just avoid this sort of frustration by booking with another more trustworthy agency,  biting the bullet and paying that little bit higher fee. It will be worth it.

Title: Updated - Continuing Terrible Customer Service
Details:
Updated - The response message from Super.com is basically just for show. They have not contacted me since this message. I have reached out and the ‘support team’ were just as supportive as before with none of the action mentioned below actually done on their side. I’ve booked with other websites in the past and never had these issues. AVOID AT ALL COSTS! Book through any other website!

————————————————

Do not book with Super.com. They have the least helpful and unsympathetic customer service in the world! 

I was transferred to Super.com to complete a booking for a non-refundable room. All went well and I swiftly progressed though the website and completed the booking. I realised when I read the booking confirmation that the dates were slightly wrong (3 days out) as a result of an issue with the transfer to their website from the comparison website. So within 5 mins of booking I had reached out to customer service via email (as the chat function was not working) explaining and asking to adjust the booking for 3 days later. I was happy to pay the difference and an admin cost (whatever was applicable) but was swiftly told that I could not amend the booking. I responded within 10 mins of receiving the email and had an auto response that the case had been closed and that my communication wouldn’t be read. 

I didn’t want a refund (as understood by booking a non refundable room) and just want to move the booking by 3 days after an error with the comparison site moving to their website. Unhelpful and terrible customer service.

Title: Don't give this company your money.
Details:
Terrible customer support. Close tickets without resolving. Booked a room and was told by the hotel they have no record of the booking nor do they have any rooms available. Sent a support request and was told to just wait with the ticket close so I can't send a response. No refund has been supplied. Do not use this company.

Provided all details requested in below response and yet to be contacted.

Title: Title: Beware of super.com: A Scam Website with Appalling Customer Service
Details:
Title: Beware of super.com: A Scam Website with Appalling Customer Service

Review:

I recently had an extremely frustrating and disheartening experience with super.com, and I feel compelled to share my story in hopes of saving others from falling victim to their deceitful practices and abysmal customer service.

First and foremost, let me address the cancellation policy. In the face of a genuine family emergency, I contacted super.com hoping to cancel a month-long booking I had made. To my disbelief, they flat out refused to accommodate my request, displaying a complete lack of empathy and understanding. Their inflexibility left me not only in a dire situation but also questioning their ethics and integrity as a travel website.

The customer service I encountered from super.com was nothing short of atrocious. Their representatives were dismissive, unhelpful, and displayed an outrageous level of unprofessionalism. They seemed disinterested in providing any real assistance, instead preferring to brush off my concerns with pre-written, unhelpful responses. It is disheartening to witness such a blatant disregard for customers' needs and a complete lack of respect.

Furthermore, attempting to resolve the issue through their website proved to be utterly futile. Their website design is convoluted, making it difficult to locate any relevant information or find a prompt resolution. It became clear to me that they purposefully make it challenging to communicate with them, likely to dissuade dissatisfied customers from pursuing their valid grievances.

In light of my appalling experience, I have decided to escalate this matter by involving my state representative. It is evident that super.com operates with a complete disregard for their customers' well-being and their own ethical responsibilities. It is my hope that an investigation into their practices will shed light on their fraudulent activities, ultimately protecting future prospective customers from falling into their trap.

In conclusion, I strongly advise everyone to avoid super.com at all costs. Their refusal to accommodate emergencies and their disgraceful customer service prove that they are nothing more than a scam website. It is not worth risking your hard-earned money, time, and peace of mind by engaging with this unscrupulous company. Choose reputable alternatives that prioritize customer satisfaction and operate with integrity.I

Title: I was scammed out of $196.97 by…
Details:
I was scammed out of $196.97 by super.com  I tried to book a hotel in my state, but reservation was in wrong state. Had nowhere to stay, called super who promised to cancel and They promised in writing on August 7 2023 to refund minus a $30 fee. A month later, they still have not and refuse now through PayPal to refund. PayPal who I spend over $10,000 a month through, has not backed me up. I will stop using PAYPAL. Definitely book your hotels elsewhere, without super.com they are dishonest scammers. RUN, don't walk away from SUPER.COM robbery. Also, don't book with pay in 4 with PayPal. They may not back you up when things go wrong with super.com

Details: The issue is not about the erroneous booking and my fault or system fault or their policies on changing or canceling, but the fact that I was indeed promised the refund after cancelling it just a few hours later when i discovered the problem and that super went back on their word after telling me what to do for a refund. I assume they thought I couldnt actually get it done. However, i jumped through all the hoops to do what super.com supervisor Monica on August 7, 2023 at 6:13 PM EST asked me to do to get a FULL refund exception with NO fee: contact the hotel, get it in writing that they authorized the cancellation under the circumstances (so they can release and re-rent the room) and email  it to Monica, then call to confirm it was received. I did it all.  Amazingly, the hotel sent me the documentation requesting that super.com refund me in full and help find me another hotel. The hotel manager said they wouldn't dream of keeping my money. I sent it over to Monica and called. It was confirmed again by Michelle, a different supervisor at 7:50 PM EST that I would get a full refund with the notes and the hotel document she read.  

Super.com did not do as promised twice by phone and refund in full. They also didn't refund anything at all.

At 7:25PM EST on August 7th, someone else at super.com (not a supervisor or manager this time) Jannah in the support department, simply sent an email stating they would refund MINUS $30. However, super.com.com didn't keep their word on this secondary promise either. They simply stopped replying for a month, and then simply refused to refund when contacted by Paypal, despite me meeting their requests and them giving their word. No responses at all... Now that i have posted all this,  super.com has the time and concern to reply? Interesting ...

The takeaway: they will lie to get you off the phone, but not keep their word. When things go wrong, can you trust them to do what's fair or right? Can you trust their word? When they are not being charged by the hotel (verified in writing) but try to keep the amount of the room rate for themselves alone after promising a refund... I think not. Read the other reviews about poor customer service, being ignored with billing issues, etc. BELIEVE them.

Title: First experience with Super.com was SUPER!
Details: My first booking was easy & at a great price. When I needed to extend my stay, the rate  was even better. I will use Super.com moving forward.

Title: 10 out of 10
Details:
The staff were very helpful. Shuttle bus to airport is available 24/7 and the driver we had at 3:00 a.m. Sept 5th was helpful and respectful. There is a selection of cereal available 24/7 as well. The room was clean. Other reviews have said the furniture was sparse. In my opinion, everything was there that you need - a small table with two chairs, a desk, an area next to desk where a suitcase could be set. I appreciate that the chairs were plastic, easy to keep clean. (I shudder sometimes at cloth covered dirty chairs in other hotel rooms.) A light on both sides of the bed. A floor to ceiling mirror so you can view yourself before heading out. While, other hotels you can only see your face. 
Shampoo and body soap dispenser in a large walk-in shower. A safe to lock valuable items. What more could one ask for? Also TV with remote, which is usual, but there was a remote for air conditioner, and the air conditioner worked well with little noise. Bed was comfy and clean. First thing I check when I enter a hotel room.
That's it. It's a 10!

Title: Terrible experience - AVOID at all costs
Details:
I don’t normally write these but I have had the worst experience with Super.com imaginable! I booked a hotel months ago and on arrival, they said my booking did not exist. I contacted Super.com to be told they would resolve it within 20 minutes and never heard back or received a solution. I subsequently called a total of 11 times within 24 hours and still had nothing back, despite having paid Super and had a confirmation number. 

I had to pay an extortionate rate at the hotel on the night as I was travelling with an 11 week old baby. I have still not heard back despite numerous follow-ups. It’s a shocking service. Do NOT use it. Super themselves use travel partners and do not have direct access to the hotels. So if there is any issue with the travel partner or the hotel, there is no way of them helping. AVOID.

Details:

We received confirmation for our booking on the 6th of August when we booked, we also had a text message the day prior to our booking, confirming our stay. On our return home, we contacted customer services at Super.com, on 7 occasions, we told them what had happened but all we kept getting back was that the case had been closed. They have not tried to contact us, even though i have asked them to, either by phone or email.  The whole experience has been a disgrace. It ruined out holiday, as OAP's it was very stressful and not being to communicate with them is being even more stressful. 

We know that sometimes things go wrong, but being in a foreign country, not being able to speak the language, and then no customer services to help you, is completely out of order,

Title: **Great customer service & clean rooms!!**
Details:
Exactly what I was hoping for!
We had a great weekend!
They've upgraded the pool to salt water, with the correct ph balance & temperature to prevent bacteria and viruses from spreading. Very relaxing! Although the pool and gym weren't huge, it was nice because, at the time that we went to swim and work out, we had the place to ourselves! 
My daughter and I even had a little time, just before dark, to play our VR headset, in the gated in area just outside of the pool area.
It was plenty of space for her and I to play beat saber and not have to worry about breaking or bumping into anything!
Breakfast was included, which is always a plus, when youre traveling with growing children who want to eat every hour on the hour. 
The shower was wonderful! It had good water pressure, and consistent temperature. 
Very clean room in comparison to many other places in the area. (I can't stress enough, how important that is to me!!)
The beds and pillows were so comfy, and I slept really well, and woke up feeling rested. One thing that really impressed me was that they provided makeup remover wipes, and a toothbrush, as a complimentary guest item, which most places would have you pay double the value for the same quality!!
Overall I was impressed with the price and quality of our stay and **the house keeping crew was so kind!** 
Thanks so much!

Title: Waited until the last second to book a…
Details: Waited until the last second to book a hotel on our trip, I've used this platform before and had great experiences so I wanted to use them again. They still had the best rates and saved me $20/per night vs the other platforms I checked. Booking was super easy, hotel offered all the amenities as advertised. Had a nice stay for less than expected. I'll keep recommending this service to everyone, their prices and customer service really can't be beat.

Title: The hotel was very friendly

Never left any garbage bags or towels and i had to ask them to clean it and they still didnt so i had to get them to clean it at 10pm and wait in the lobby also when checking in my room wasnt ready until 6pm and check in was supposed to be 3pm they never offered any discounts or anything they gave another guest a bag of goodies for the inconvenience and never offered me a anything and i was there longer then them...But besides that, they were very friendly and very helpful thank you to the maid that helped me when she seen me lock myself out of my room

Title: The prices are great, terrible customer service and was overbooked.
Details:
The prices are great, the hotel I got was exactly what I expected so all that was good. However I was overbooked, which in hindsight I feel frequent hotel stayers can avoid however if you’re planning ahead I can see how that can be a huge problem especially since I had to double my spending to get a room for the exact dates. 
The three star is due to the customer service being below average since it’s been three weeks, 4 calls and numerous 30 minute holes in trying to get my money back, all for a “we’re working on it”. I assume they’re just waiting for me to forget about it so they can make up for the money lost on their cheap prices.

Title: Simple, Fast and the best price, thank you!

The company are near on impossible to contact. The links on their website do not work. Their customer service number , which is based in America rang for 25 minutes, saying we were in position one in the queue, it then cut off. The comoany made no attempt to contact us and didn’t respond to our call or emails. My husband went through a complaint company to contact super.com. Who then confirmed our hotel will be closed. They offered no replacement accommodation and had no intention of notifying us before arrival.  Avoid at all cost, rip off!

Details:

WE REPLYED TO SUPER.COM ON THE 28th AUGUST BY E-MAIL AS THEY ASKED US TO AND WE HAVE NOT HAD A REPLY AS YET!....THIS IS NOW TWO WEEKS SO MAKES ME WONDER WILL WE EVER GET OUR MONEY BACK.......

Title: Super.com is a scam
Details: Horrible company.  Super Travel is a scam.  They do not make your reservation at the hotel.  When you call them they make you wait hours at the hotel for them to "confirm" your reservation. They told me after 3 hrs that they can't get thru to the hotel and offered a refund.  After a week of no refund I call.  They tell me they confirmed my reservation with the hotel and I won't get a refund since I cancelled.   I have email copies of our conversations and they still tell me I cancelled.  Do not use their service.  Super.com and Super Travel.

Title: Horrible stay on my Birthday
Details:
The first room I was checked into had a nonworking air conditioner. The second room I was checked into was right next to the pool or a group of unsupervised children was screaming so loudly it sounded like they were in the room with us. The third room I was checked into smelled so strongly of urine and the chemical that they use to clean it up that we had to sleep with the sliding glass door open.
When I complained about it, I got the runaround, I was sent multiple emails, denial of my refund and then being told by “Customer Service” that it’s not their fault and they can’t control the hotel’s cleanliness.
I was there on my birthday, and I will never go back again. I will never use this company to book another hotel, and I will never recommend them to anyone. I know I will go out of my way to make sure that no one I know suffers through an experience like that.

Title: Terrible Customer Support
Details: I was driving across the US and reserved a hotel room along my route. Hurricane Hilary hit California and closed the roads. Because of this I had to cancel my reservation. The "travel partner", Days Inn, was very understanding and approved the refund. Super.com however, has been a nightmare. The customer support staff are all robotic slaves and unforgiving. They point to policies, are incompetent even with travel partner approval, and show absolutely no care or mercy. I am disputing the charge through my credit card company as the cancellation wasn't my fault and the refund was approved by the hotel. It's really not worth the $10 you might save with them.

Title: After a 9 hour drive to Scotland to…
Details:
After a 9 hour drive to Scotland to attend a wedding the hotel booked through Super.com told me they had cancelled the reservation the previous day despite my receiving a text to confirm my booking the same previous day. I had paid in full at time of booking. I contacted the company who told me someone would call within 10 mins. FIVE HOURS later no call, nowhere to stay and I was in my car in a remote part of Scotland. The chat bot gave me a number to call and I was charged £200 for the call after being in a Q for some time. The communication was dire, I was lied to and trying to resolve this dispute has proved very difficult as they do not engage with issues I raise. I shifted my focus to the US head office and have received NO response at all from them. I would not advise using this company at all.
REGARDING the company response: I was stranded in the middle of nowhere with no place to sleep and no help from the company. They refunded the money I paid for the room but NO compensation was offered for the distress caused OR for the £200 I was charged for calling their help line. DO NOT BOOK WITH THIS COMPANY

Title: Seamless experience with minimal steps…

Title: Fast hotel search
Details: Fast hotel search, easy bookings. Cheap rates

Title: Unbeatable pricing
Details:
I had seen an unbeatable price when booking. I had never heard of Super.com until now, and I was nervous as a result.

What I am certain is that Super.com provided an excellent service in terms of their communication following the booking. Their means of communication was through whatsap messaging. It was clear and to the point such as confirmation of booking, validation of dates, place, and room type, along with links for directions and uber info if needed, including survey satisfaction.  I became at ease as they delivered updates with promptness and readiness that a follow-up was not even required.

I will be sure to check Super.com again before planning another destination or get-a-way.  Bottom line though, as long as Super.com has unbeatable prices that are unmatched in the period chosen, then I would definitely consider booking with them again.

Title: Dishonest
Details: They 'verify' you by asking for your tel number, which they say they'll send marketing to (dodgy). We went to proceed with the purchase and within moments of doing the search then they declined the booking stating price had gone up by £50. We decided straight away to book it anyway, then they declined it again saying the price had gone up by another £50! They offer you a cheap price to get you looking, then hike up the price immediately, complete scammers.

Title: Dishonorable and untrustworthy
Details: I booked a reservation for a hotel after my house caught fire and a second reservation was accidentally made. I contacted SuperTravel and a customer service rep told me my funds would be reissued in 2-3 business days. That did not occur. I called them back multiple times and finally got them to escalate the call to a manager, Mark Louie. He called me back and the phone rang 3 times and disconnected - I did not have time to catch the call before he hung up. He then responded via email (despite my request for a phone call) stating the reservation was non refundable and I needed a letter with signatures from the hotel owner and others stating they could refund me. I responded via email that they need to check my call where the customer service rep said I would be refunded. I emailed them 2-3 times with no response. I called back multiple times and Mark Louie called me back, only repeating it was non refundable and then the phone disconnected mid conversation. I tried calling back repeatedly but never heard from him again. I finally got the information of a new Supervisor, Annie, who was sympathetic to my situation and agreed they should honor what I was told originally and that she would negotiate a deal. I then received an Email from her stating I would not be refunded without that letter. My father passed away a month after the fire and I do not have time to jump through hoops, especially after I was told by the company I would receive my refund. A legitimate, reputable company would stay true to their word and not fight someone in their time of need. They are not a honorable and trustworthy business and I can only feel as though I've been scammed. And if you have to contact them after your reservation has been made, good luck getting through to them, especially if you need to speak to a manager. Beware doing business with SuperTravel

Title: Misleading price
Details: Hi. I booked the hotel via super travel. Upon booking I was not told that there will be extra charges to pay at hotel when checking out. It's very misleading for customer to pay unexpected charge. Today when we checked out they asked me to pay $200 for some strange fee which is experience fee that covers room service, using Wi-Fi which was stated as free in the hotel, using lift, computer which we never used. Usually when we book room that covers all that. What we are paying for then? Only the bed in the room? This is totally unfair and I am so upset with that. This is why they show less price and later charged via hotel. Booking number B_10238219

Title: Slept on a floor in new York and they never got back to me on my request
Details: I was really disappointed this weekend with super travel. My mum has breathing issues and so she has to sleep with breathing machines at night. For this reason I knew she needed her own bed on our vacation and so I booked a 2 bedroom hotel room. When I got to the hotel they informed me super travel had booked wrong room and they had no 2 bedroom rooms left. I contacted super travel who admitted to the mistake. I asked super travel to cover the cost of the room for that night as I had to sleep on the floor in the hotel as it was already 7pm at night and I needed my mother to have somewhere to sleep. I also didn't want to spend my last night of vacation stumbling around new York at night. Super travel sent me one email saying they were looking into options and they would contact me within 20 mins, but it's been silent now for 48 hours. In truth it's a shame, I am a big traveller and probably a customer they would want as a regular as I go away at least every month. I slept on a floor in new York. I feel that could have least offered me some vouchers for the inconvenience they caused if they weren't able to give me my money back. I'll never use them again.

The only was for me to know if the error is if super.com let me know or by me checking in to the hotel. Ernabelle had the cheek to tell me the wrong hotel...... how ?

I do not want credits, i simply want access to the royal level amenities thats all.

B_10580996

Title: DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY!!!!
Details:

Noone listens.  DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY!!!!  
Your response is incorrect.  I did not dispute it through my bank, it was Paypal who will not get involved because you told them you had provided a valid reservation number.  Please refund my money.
8/24/2023 UPDATE:  Still no refund or contact from them. I have emailed them again requesting an email and advised that I would like to reach some sort of resolution.

Title: Do not use Super.com, formerly known as SnapTravel.com
Details:
They unilaterally cancelled the reservation!!! DO NOT TRUST THESE PEOPLE!!! I booked business class seats for my 90 year old mother and sister on Lufthansa in February 2023 for travel June 30th to Europe through SnapTravel.com now known as Super.com. I received a confirmation number and eticket numbers. I was able to select seats for them right away and even order a wheelchair for my mother a week before their flight. They went to the airport on the day of travel, and the Lufthansa ticket agent told them that their tickets had been refunded, but they had received no notification from SnapTravel and no refund. They had to buy the last two economy tickets on the only available light to Europe that at a cost of 6,600 USD for both.
Snaptravel send out an email to my mother THE DAY AFTER their scheduled travel. I included the email below. DO NOT BOOK WITH THESE PEOPLE!!! DO NOT TRUST THEM!!! THEY COULD DO TO YOU WHAT THEY DID TO MY FAMILY!!!

***Email received a day too late….on July 1st
Hello,

We are reaching out to you from Super's (formerly SnapTravel) Corporate team regarding your upcoming flight reservation made through a third party, Bookingvault.  In the event that your flight has already been completed, you can disregard this message.

We have recently learned that, for reasons beyond Super’s control, the party with whom you booked your flight(s), Bookingvault, has ceased operations.  Please note that your reservation is still valid and you can continue to travel as scheduled.  However, because your booking was with Bookingvault and not Super, Super has limited access to service your reservation.  For support, you can contact the airline of travel through their customer service lines.  For cancellation or change requests, you can contact the airline or we suggest reaching out to your bank to request for assistance for a card refund/reimbursement, due to Bookingvault’s inaccessibility.  
We reiterate our apologies for any inconvenience and we appreciate your patience and understanding.

Regards,
Corporat
