Title: Awesome at first but turns into a nightmare.
Details: I booked a one night stay at a hotel I stay at frequently. Booked it through the app. Apon checking in, I was informed I booked it for the following day. I did make a mistake. I contacted Supers customer service via online chat. The app states that's fastest way to receive service . After a brief wait of 5 min or so I chatted with a rep. I explained I had made a mistake and would like to change the date to today. The rep informed me there would be a small fee of $30 to change the date. A small fee is not half the price of the room. After going back and forth with him he did waive the fee. He instructed me I would be getting a phone call from the department who can make the changes. He said he didn't know how long it would take. The first line of customer service doesn't have the ability to do much at all. Just a waste of time. No matter what the issue, someone has to call you back. I wait, chatting with the hotel staff for about 40 min. Still can't check in. I was able to locate a toll free number to call them. Hoping that a person on the phone could help me. I provided the rep with all the requested details of my booking and explained the situation. I asked if she could make the changes so I could check in. She said she apologizes but she can't. She said the dept that can is working on the changes now and id recieve a phone call within 20 min. A half hour comes and still no call. I have now been waiting to chage the date of check in from 8/7/23 to 8/6/23. Should not be difficult. So I again call customer service as it's been an hour. After providing all the details and explaining I have been waiting for a call and have not received one yet. She checks and comes back and says the exact same thing as last rep. She apologized for the inconvenience but the right department is working on it as we speak. She tells me id recieve a phone call from the department that can make the changes in 45 min.. Wait, What? I was told 20 min an hour ago. She said she was sorry but that's all she can do. I asked to speak to aa supervisor. .I was only trying to change a date by one day. Not buy the hotel. Shouldn't take but a few min. The rep said sure, I'll have a suoerviser give you a call. They will call in in about 3 hrs. I said nevermind and laughed. So your first line of customer service wether on chat or over phone is absolutely useless.  I hung up the phone with no choice but to continue to wait. It's been well over an hour since I had contacted them to change the date. I did receive a call from the department that I was told could fix it. The rep told me there was no way for super.com to change the date. He said he would need to call the hotel and have the hotel cancel my reservation I had for 8/7/23 and refund my money so I could book the date of 8/6/23 directly with the hotel. He contacted the hotel and called me back. He tells me if I follow through with the cancelation for 8/7/23 it will take 30 days to get a refund. he lead me to believe id get the refund right away so I could book today's date. I did not have an additional $90 to book another room since they took my money and won't get it back for 30 days. Super left me totally scared and I'm forced to sleep in my car for the night. Thanks super.com.

Title: BEWARE OF BOOKING WITH SUPER.COM—They…
Details:
BEWARE OF BOOKING WITH SUPER.COM—They make you pay in advance and the hotels don’t honor the reservation.

I booked a room for July 8-9, 2023 at Cape Rey Carlsbad Beach in Carlsbad CA through Super.com. Upon arrival, I was told by the manager the hotel does not receive the bookings from Super and that this has been communicated to Super on multiple occasions. 

I was forced to book a room with the hotel on my own at a much higher rate, and at my own expense, even though I had already paid Super for the reservation. I did so at the same hotel.  I called customer service and was told I would be reimbursed for the charges 3-5 days by emailing the receipt from the hotel for the charges I incurred. I did so the night my stay ended. 

After receiving no response, I followed up by email again… only to be told that the “hotel partner” indicated I was a “no show” and I would not be reimbursed (The receipt I provided was for the SAME HOTEL I BOOKED WITH SUPER.COM). I called again and was told that the decision was based upon the “Hilton Orlando” indicating I was a “no show”, a hotel more than 3,000 miles away from the hotel I booked. 

I have called 4 times over the last week. Each time I was told I would be called back within 45 minutes by someone who could help me.  NO ONE HAS EVER CALLED ME!  
NO ONE HAS REIMBURSED ME!!!  Aren’t  there laws against charging people for services that are not provided?

Title: Won't use them ever again...
Details:
Booked a "Deluxe King Suite with Garden View" for 3 nights at a BnB and when we arrived to check in, we were informed that the room did not have an attached bathroom and that we would need to go down the hall and down a flight of steps to use a bathroom on lower level. Couldn't reach Super via tele, BnB had no other rooms, so had to find alternative place to stay. Had online chat with customer service later that evening and they indicated that they were going to stick by their no refund policy. We pointed out that their site did not clarify that the facility had ANY rooms without attached bathroom & what we purchased was not what was delivered --- Choice was not willing to be honest in this transaction.

UPDATE as of August 17, 2023: I turned to ElliotAdvocacy.org for assistance with this situation and provided them with the documentation surrounding the problem. I am not sure what they did but within a week Super.com had issued a full credit to my credit card.

Update: They say they will not refund and we should reach out to the hotel to get confirmation that they would refund to Super. In other words, they want it to be our problem that they sold us a "deluxe king room" with no notice that it didn't have a bathroom attached rather than looking at their own advertising and realizing that they had not provided their customer (us) with an accurate description of what we were purchasing. It seems that they have the belief that if they fail to provide information to a client and the product is not as represented, they have no responsibility to make things right. We purchased from them... if they failed to get information from their supplier (the BnB), then it is not our responsibility to pay the bill - they somehow missed presenting the details on their webpage that would have alerted us to the fact that the room would not have a bathroom. We have no idea whether or not the Pepin Mansion misrepresented their accommodations to Super but this is a dispute to be settled between them and should not be up to us to absorb the cost of an error due to miscommunication between the Pepin Mansion and Super.com

Title: It was very easy to use the website and…I actually paid what the website offered as a special. No fees, no upcharge, no bait click nonsense. Very simple and easy. Obviously a reputable company.
Details:
It was very easy to use the website format, it was actually faster than reserving a room on the traditional hotel website. I was worried there may be some kind of 'bait and switch' but it was straight up a great deal.   I saved 50% and would have paid almost twice as much on the hotel website. The room? No worries....it was one of their regular, very nice rooms with a king sized bed, luxury furnishings and a great view. It was not the traditional studio dive other travel websites are known for sticking it to you with, as they know full well you have already paid and have little or no recourse in upgrading or  requesting a decent, normal room. You know what I mean, the awful surprise waiting you after checking in at the desk and arriving at your assigned hotel room with high hopes and fingers crossed that your 'discounted' room is indeed a real room with clean sheets at least and a flushable toilet. One where the mold isn't growing on the bathroom door jams. One where the pillow cases are not infused with curly thick hair and the fear of discovering a used pair of panties stuck between the sheet and blanket doesn't give you anxiety fits. Indeed, one where the sides of the bed are not an advertisement for each guest to openly & without hesitation use the sheet as a handkerchief or be tempted to wipe other and all necessary bodily fluids under the covers for the maids to worry about later. One where the smell of incontinence has been at least 'fabreezed' away and the ice bucket has not been used as a handy 'throw up,' 'vomit' or 'puke' bucket. Even still, one where the ice bucket has not been used or conveniently turned into a bedpan or pisspot for each hotel guest resembling an Oger or last night's late arriving guest resembling 'fat lazy uncle Joe' who was so late he missed out on all the good rooms but Instead got a helluva deal on this room. Instead you are bartering with God for a real, 'regular room' with at least a double or queen mattress next to the porta potty still fresh with unfiltered blue chemical, able to flush at least once. "A pleasant room," you ever so least silently pray for...one where the window is not obstructed 2 inches on the outside by the unsettling and cumbersome view of an enormous cement wall at least 200 ft tall.  One not allowing for any kind of view and certainly one in which you are unable to discern night from day.   No, other travel websites might stick you in one of their 'regular' or 'special' rooms. But not Super.com. Their room is all you prayed for and paid for
  I had no issues, no problems and quickly booked my room. 
Further, as is customary for other travel discount sites, they advertise a killer rate and anticipate you will click and check out the wonderful rate. As happened with 4 other sites, the room at this hotel was advertised for $39 a night, however when I clicked on those other sites to proceed, suddenly the dollar amount $249 appeared. There was no mention as to what happened to the fabulous $39 deal. Click Bait and I really despise those kind of fraudulent sights. Thank you to Super.com! They advertised the room at $49 and I actually paid $49. No hidden fees, no increases or upcharges. That is why I recommend it and wrote such a good review. I appreciate their integrity and will be using them again real soon!

Title: I strongly advise against engaging with…
Details:
I strongly advise against engaging with this company due to their poor refund process and unhelpful customer service. Despite the initial impression of cost savings, I regret choosing them for my stay at the Hilton on April 20, 2023. I canceled the trip on July 10th, which was the last eligible day for a refund. According to their communication, the refund was processed and should have been returned to the original payment card within 1-5 business days.

However, five business days passed, and I did not receive the refund. Since then, I have made numerous phone calls and sent multiple emails, encountering unresponsive and repetitive responses from their agents. They simply state that the refund has been processed and advise me to contact my bank. I explained that my bank confirmed having no record of the refund, and I even offered to share my credit card statement as proof.

Their agents lack transparency and seem defensive, with one of them attempting to misinform me about the processing time, contrary to their own stated terms and conditions. As of today, I have still not received the refund, which amounts to nearly $1000.00. This experience has left a negative impression, and I will not consider using their services in the future.

Title: Be Aware of Possible Technical Glitches and Lackluster Customer Support
Details:
I am compelled to share my disappointing experience with SuperTravel, hoping it might serve as a cautionary tale for others who choose to use this platform for their travel bookings.

My ordeal started when I attempted to book a room at Centro Hotel Arde Köln through SuperTravel. During the booking process, I was confronted with a technical error message stating, "There was an error, nothing was charged." Naturally, I retried the booking, only to find out later that I had been charged twice.

Understandably, technical glitches happen, and I wouldn't judge a service solely on that. The real issue began when I tried to rectify the error. I immediately contacted SuperTravel's customer support to explain the situation. Despite promptly reaching out and providing all the necessary details, my efforts to solve the issue were met with an unsatisfactory response.

Instead of understanding the unique circumstances of my case and working on a fair resolution, I was met with a rigid stance that the booking was non-refundable and non-amendable. While I respect the policy in normal circumstances, this was clearly a case of a technical error, resulting in an unintended double booking.

The handling of my situation was not just disappointing, but I found it to be somewhat humiliating. The lack of empathy and the apparent unwillingness to address a problem that originated from their own system was surprising and disheartening. It's a sad state of affairs when the burden of rectifying a mistake falls on the customer, not the service provider.

I now find myself having to involve my bank to dispute the charges and resolve a situation that could have been easily addressed with some understanding and customer-focused support from SuperTravel.

In summary, potential customers should be aware of my experience. I would advise caution when dealing with SuperTravel, given my encounter with a technical glitch and subsequent subpar customer service. As a result of this incident, I will likely not be utilizing their services again in the future. It's crucial for any business, especially in the travel industry, to not just provide a platform for booking but also reliable and fair customer support when things go awry. Unfortunately, based on my experience, SuperTravel falls short in this regard.

EDIT: I GAVE THEM ADDITIONAL INFORMATION AND AM WAITING FOR ANY RESPONSE

Title: Absolutely awful company- Don't use
Details: Absolutely awful company that won't give us our refund. Our flight home from Madeira got cancelled and after many hours of trying TO find a hotel we finally booked a hotel via supertravel. Confirmation B-10032486. We arrived at the hotel late at night after spending all day in the airport to be advised they did not have a reservation. I showed them the confirmation and the voucher super travel had issued but the hotel had no confirmation or payment. The hotel would only give us a room if we paid them directly upfront. It was very late so we reluctantly agreed in the hope it would be sorted in the morning. It wasn't. We contacted supertravel who were apologised and and advised a refund would be issued in 5-7 days. Almost 3 weeks later and despite us making contact with them several times and empty promises later we still have no refund. We have paid for a hotel room twice that we used for 6 hours. PLEASE DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY.

Title: Don't ever use this company the…
Details: Don't ever use this company, the refundable rooms are everything but. The booking says your room is refundable up to a certain date. Unless you click on "your dead" or in a hospital emergency then this company will reject your refund. After they have rejected your refund this company closes your case so that you can not apply for another reason. Avoid this company. They are con artists, there's not even a customer service number to ring. Please to everyone else out there leave these guys alone and don't get ripped off like I have!!!!!!!!!!

Title: Terrible
Details:
Well they removed my review after responding to it so I'll cover the issue again.

I booked a room at Hilton Cobham (B_10098753).

Latest issue is, lucky I phoned the Hilton to check as the booking does not exist on their system and it is confirmed that if I show up there will be no room for me and I'll have to pay an exorbitant price at the desk. Thanks for that Super.

Original problem; when I booking this I received a confirmation email for the Hilton, aong with a second confirmation from booking.com for a hotel in Madrid! Same date, same price, same time confirmation email, same room type. But different website (I had not even been on booking.com so how was it hacked?). I have had to go in and cancel the mystery booking. So is my account, and therefore my banking details, somehow compromised? I do not know.

And their response from my first review - before they took it down was;

"Hi Rich,

We are truly sorry to hear about your experience, however, we kindly ask you to provide the reservation ID and details of your booking so we can look into this further. Please also provide your email address used for the booking."

Well that would be fine if you actually had a contact email address. You have a live chat system where the advisor refuses to answer the anomaly question., then simply confirms the first booking exists when it does not. 

What a mess.

Title: NEVER Again
Details: I booked a room for a one night stay at a hotel 250 miles out the evening before I left for my trip. The day of my arrival prior to check in, the hotel did not have my reservation. I contacted customer service and they fixed the issue, got my room, no big deal. Now this is where the issue comes in. The hotel I was staying at charged me an additional $200 because they said SuperTravel did not pay them! I told the hotel I have a receipt of my payment through SuperTravel but it didn't matter since the company didn't pay them. When I started chatting with SuperTravel customer service, I gave my confirmation number and email, the representative said the email was wrong. I literally had to send them a screenshot to prove it was correct. After that, they told me to email customer support to get my refund. I haven't heard from ANYONE through email. I then just disputed the charge with my bank and hoping to get my money back that way. If I had known it would be this ridiculous I would've stayed away from them to begin with.

Title: Canceled my reservation 2 days before our trip
Details:
Synopsis: If you're reading this because you found a deal and you're worried it's too good to be true, then take this review as a warning of the risks in trusting supertravel. Obviously I can only speak to my experience, but if anything goes wrong with your booking, supertravel will not hesitate to leave you in the lurch and waste your time and money.

Canceled my reservation 2 days before we were due to fly in at midnight. Left me in the lurch and did the absolute bare minimum to help me by giving me a refund that still hasn't come through. Cost me hundreds of dollars and a lot of stress as I needed to rebook at the last minute. Offered no assistance in rebooking a hotel, and I eventually found a much more expensive one through airbnb. They did give me a 20% credit for my next booking to make up for their mistake, but this is a clear attempt to just make sure I use their service again (which I never will). I can't warn people enough to avoid this service at all costs

Updates: Super Travel still have not issued me a refund two weeks after they said they would. I have reached out to them again over the phone since I left this review, and was told that someone would contact me by the end of the day (5 July) via email. I have not received any such email. This company has put me through an incredibly frustrating two weeks by cancelling my booking, failing to deliver the refund two weeks later, and offering barely any customer support. The only thing they did in a timely manner was report this review as being fake, and reply to it publicly. It should also be noted that the reply to my review offered no means of contacting them directly, and that they made no attempt to reach out to me as a result. Clearly it is an attempt at public damage control rather than a genuine effort to make the situation right and actually provide me with any help. To anyone reading this review who is questioning whether or not to purchase anything through super travel, I once again say do not do it! If anyone from super travel is reading this, then know that I am reaching out to you regarding this matter at your hello email address.

Final Update: I gave them plenty of time, but the promised refund never came. Had to request a chargeback. I figured I'd update because this is still going on, weeks after the initial call from them. The risks are really not worth it.

Title: They’ve created impossible refund guidelines on purpose!
Details:
Absolutely the worst refund experience I've ever went through!  We show up to the hotel and they don't have a pool as advertised.  So we cancel and the manager said to not worry about it and she would help refund, so we left and went down the street to another hotel.  We call SuperTravel that night and they say they won’t except a refund unless the hotel manager sends a signed email to them. The hotel manager said they never do that with third parties and didn't feel comfortable so they called them up instead and SuperTravel LITERALLY told TWO different managers that they needed the signed email to refund!  Can you imagine?!!  The hotel themselves calling the third party saying "refund them" and SuperTravel telling them no!  Avoid this company at all costs!

UPDATE after their response:
They sound all kind and understanding but......they actually submitted paperwork to refute my refund at the credit card company with "proof" that the hotel charged SuperTravel!  Totally lied to VISA!  I have paperwork from the hotel manager SHOWING they were never charged and that the hotel cancelled the reservation on their end right away!  I'll be fighting this, but it looks grim guys.  These guys are crooks and they know they get away with it often!  Stay away!!!

Title: Bait and switch for inferior room at same cost
Details: I recently booked a last minute hotel room using Super through Kayak. The next morning I received an email stating the hotel I booked was overbooked and offering me an alternative which was not in any way comparable. It was 20 miles away with far less acceptable reviews and where I had booked a room with 2 beds this one only had 1 bed. All for the same price of course. The email did state that if the alternative was not acceptable the reservation could be canceled free of charge. I responded I wished to cancel the reservation and please let me know when I could expect a refund. 3 days later I still had not received any communication from the company or any attempt to refund my money. I contacted my bank and disputed the charges, provided the proof that they did not provide the service and had the charge reversed. Within hours of taking that action I received an email from them about how I had initiated the a chargeback and caused my bank to remove the funds from their account. Funny you can respond so quickly when I take corrective action myself but can’t respond for days and days and days to a customer requesting a refund when you failed to provide a room as promised. Bait and switch. Buyer beware. I will never use them again.

Title: BUYER BEWARE!
Details:
BEWARE OF THIS COMPANY!  I booked and paid for a hotel room with Super.com and had two confirmation messages clearly stating my booking of a "standard double" room.  However, the "check-in voucher" they provided stated that the room that had been booked was an "economy single".  I raised this with Super.com and the agent agreed that there had been an error.  BUT - they refused to modify the booking to the room I had paid for, refused to cancel the booking, and they would not refund my money under ANY circumstances, even breach of contract.  I paid for a standard double room, the hotel gets paid for an economy single - classic "bait and switch"

UPDATE:  10 days later and still no resolution from this dreadful company despite supplying them with the information they requested in their response to my review.  I have now begun a Section 75 refund claim with my credit card supplier.

FINAL UPDATE:  Super.com's "escalation to their urgent care team" proved to be a waste of time as I was fed more deceit and lies.  Needless to say, they offered no resolution.  I sent my credit card supplier my collected evidence of Super.com's lies, cover-ups and double-dealing.  I received a full refund in response and the matter is now closed.  Some additional information about Super.com:  I discovered that many of the advertised rooms are, in fact, affiliate postings, Super.com not acting as a direct agent but only as a promoter, earning a commission from each booking.  In my case the room listings were falsely described and used images that were not authorised by the hotel in question - the hotel were not happy to learn of this and told me they'd be taking up the matter with Expedia who Super.com used to make the booking.  If you still want to book with these shysters, double check Super.com's relationship with the hotel first - it may turn out that they have no permission by the hotel to sell accommodation on their behalf.

Title: Terrible Experience!
Details:
Terrible Experience!! I will NEVER use this company again!! Save yourself the headache and go with a well-known company. 

SuperTravel had outdated info for a hotel. The name of the hotel was incorrect, and because of this discrepancy, the hotel did not have my reservation information. Therefore, I wouldn't be able to check-in at the hotel.

I contacted SuperTravel because I booked a day in advance, and I was concerned about not having a place to stay.

Customer Service was not good at all. They were not rude, but no one at SuperTravel took ownership of the situation not even their "amendment team." Everyone that I talked to would speak as if they were reading from a script, w/no genuine desire to help. I asked to speak with a supervisor/manager, and the person that DID call me, only allowed the phone to ring once. They then sent me an email with a BS empathy statement. No one knew how long it was going to take to resolve my issue. 

While they worked on contacting their "travel partner" to resolve the issue, SuperTravel wanted me to go out of town with two small children without the guarantee that my issue would be resolved in time to check-in at the hotel. 

I requested a refund since they couldn't provide me with the service, and they said that my booking was non-refundable. However, they were going to contact their "travel partner" to see if they would approve my refund request. 

Keep in mind, that due to an eror on SuperTravel's side, I couldn't check-in at the hotel. Basically, they were holding my money hostage and they couldn't give me a refund without someone's approval.

 Lucky for me, their system canceled my reservation and automatically refunded me.

Thanks to this headache, I missed two days of my vacation.

Title: Hard no
Details:
Hard no. I searched via the default page, which was linked from hotel searching via Google. Google's link showed the 19th, which was incorrect, but when I landed Super's page it showed the 16th. I searched and found the hotel I wanted and booked. Well, clearly a bug in the matrix, but it booked for the 19th. Def a bug that hid the fact that it was still holding on to Google's date of the 19th behind the scenes.
Non refundable, which I knew, and that was fine if the date had been correct. You'll never get someone on the phone.

Title: Illigitimate SCAMMERS!! AVOID THIS CO.!!
Details:
Super Travel is not a legitimate company. I got stranded in MO because my car broke down as I was moving from MN to AZ. It was supposed to be fixed by a certain time but the parts provider gave me bad parts. I had to change my hotel dates, I called the hotel and it was okay to change the dates with them, but they said I had to change it through Super Travel. Super Travel says you can modify the dates on their website, but you can't if the hotel doesn't allow cancellations and this hotel does not allow cancellations (though they will allow a date change). I had no choice but to call Super Travel. They've kept me on hold for TWO HOURS AND 33 minutes so far. I made it through a 34 person cue, made it to position 1, they kicked my back to position 4 in the cue, and then the kicked me back to position 11 in the cue. This company forces you to call them then refuses to answer the phones. They will royally screw up any travel plans and make my travel crisis exponentially worse because they aren't legitimate and cannot even do something as basic as answer phones. Super Travel is nothing but a time sucking scammer and they should be put out of business.

Edit: I reported Super to the BBB for claiming to provide services (phone support) that they don’t actually provide bc I had to stay on the phone 3hrs & 32 min total just to be able to talk to someone. When you have to miss half a day of work to contact phone services, that is not legitimate provision of phone support services because it places an excessive and oppressive burden on the customer to access the services. No one can miss half a day of work, or has an extra 3 hrs & 32 min, to utilize Super’s phone support when travel plans get unexpectedly disrupted. If Super wants to review this situation, they should respond to the BBB complaint I filed.

Title: I'd never recommend this company for anything, even under new ownership, NO!
Details:

I'm then contacted back with an email saying a 20ml "replacement bottle" has been sent. The customer service ask me to print and return the other bottle, which still wouldn't make the amount in the order correct, or what I had consented for in the emails.

I contacted customer service several times afterwards, 41 to be exact from (May 13th-present June 11th) and was denied a refund because "the original bottle was opened". That original bottle was opened almost a month ago! I'd only need to return 10 ML to have my order complete, if that's the case! Please, stop ripping people off, and LISTEN to their request! Also, did I mention THIS PRODUCT DOESN'T WORK!

Also, note the date at the bottom where I'm being contact back, June 12th, previously contacted them on here in May! LoL And not one person has offered to refund my order! Never again!

Title: I booked with Supertravel.com in May…
Details:
I booked with Supertravel.com in May 2023. They changed my hotel and I did confirm it was OK to do so. From that point on my experience was horrible. The hotel that they reserved had no reservation for me. They state this could be the case in their fine print weeks out but it will be in place before your date of travel. I was forced to get a very short notice reservation at another hotel at a much higher price.I called the original hotel at check in time just to see if it occurred last minute, it had not.
I called Supertravel several time and spent hours on the phone (I tried their call back service twice and never got a call back.)
I emailed them to request a refund and have yet to get any response at all.
Supertravel is a complete rip off. 
I wouldn't give any stars if given the option.
Avoid at all costs.


Update
Whomever set me the auto generated response from Supertravel, I have already sent your company all the information you asked for. If you would like me to send the info again, give me an email I can send it to. It would appear the one on your website doesn’t get responded to at all. 
Thanks

Title: Avoid dealing with this company if you…
Details:
Avoid dealing with this company if you can.  I booked with them a month and a half ago a single night at a local hotel.  The booking itself went through smoothly but when I checked in at the hotel I was not given the King bed for which I had paid extra when I booked the room on super.com.

The hotel said they couldn't help me and that I had to contact the booking agency.  So I raised it up with them, they did nothing.  I had to settle for what the hotel had given me.  I kept pushing super.com for an explanation or some sort of resolution and they eventually directed me to their amendments team.  They said they would provide me with a refund for my poor experience within 72 hours.

After 1 week passed and no refund I contacted them again.  They ghosted me.  Every week since then I've opened the chat, followed up and all I get is an endless "the amendment team will get back to you soon", they never do.  It has already been a month and a half and no one from the amendment team has responded to my emails and the chat support is now on a loop saying the same thing.

I'm just about to file a chargeback with the bank because I am now beyond frustrated.  Fortunately my lost was just a single night booking and I can live with that.  And being truthful I would have settled even for a partial refund, not even a full refund since I did use the booking after all, but the fact that they just ignore me, do not follow through and do not provide any sort of actual help when the issue happened left me with a very sower experience I do not want to repeat.

UPDATE: you've asked me to provide you with a reservation ID and an email but failed to tell me where I should send such details.  Happy to provide the details and further evidence as needed but you'll have to tell me where I must send them since I obviously can't put them publicly here.

UPDATE 2: Have sent requested info to super.com.

Title: STAY AWAY! SCAM!
Details:
I would like to give this review a negative star! STAY AWAY FROM SUPER TRAVEL! THEY ARE A SCAM!

I accidentally booked the wrong date for a hotel, I called Super Travel within 5 minutes when I realized the wrong date was booked. I don't know how it booked the hotel for a full month from the date I actually needed it. I needed the hotel booking for the next day from when I was booking it. They were EXTREMELY unhelpful! All I wanted to do was move my reservation to the correct date. I didn't want to cancel and move away from Super Travel, I still wanted to use Super Travel for the booking. I just needed to move the reservation from the wrong date to the correct date. They still would have gotten the booking, they still would have gotten their money! They told me nothing could be done, try calling the hotel to cancel the reservation. I know that's not possible since I booked it through Super Travel and not directly through the hotel, but I called the hotel anyway to cancel it. Of course I knew the hotel was going to tell me I had to cancel it through the third part Super Travel.

I disputed it with my bank and SHOCKINGLY by bank lost the claim! Super Travel prodived documentation to my bank that somehow showed it's my fault and the bank could not get my money back. So there was a reservation at the hotel that was never used and I was out of luck, having to pay for the room twice when I only used it once! The blessing though was that when I booked the actual date I needed, I booked it directly through the hotel and it was cheaper than going through Super Travel.

Screw your policy about non-refundable! I didn't want a refund, I was still going to give you my money! All I wanted you to do was move my reservation to the correct date I needed!

STAY AWAY FROM SUPER TRAVEL! SUPER TRAVEL IS A SCAM!

Title: DISCOUNT OFFERS NOT AS ADVERTISED
Details:
DISCOUNT OFFERS NOT AS ADVERTISED - TAKE CARE EVERYONE & heed this advice. Was offered 10% discount on a 2nd booking if I referred a friend & they made a booking. We did just that. But when I went to make my 2nd booking the discount code wouldn’t accept. Transpires the 10% discount on 2nd booking applies only AFTER the friend has completed and RETURNED from that booking. Isn’t made clear at all. The offer is certainly not as advertised. I’ve been swindled! Go elsewhere & don’t be misled by discounts that aren’t what they seem.

NO, I’M AFRAID YOUR RESPONSE DOESN’T HELP AT ALL. THE OFFER VERY CLEARLY STATES 10% 2ND BOOKING WHEN YOU INTRODUCE A FRIEND - THEY GET 10% OFF THEIR BOOKING & I GET 10% MY 2ND BOOKING. WHAT IT DOESN’T  SAY - UNTIL YOU GO TO MAKE THE 2ND BOOKING - IS THAT THE OFFER DOESN’T APPLY UNTIL AFTER THE FRIEND HAS ACTUALLY COMPLETED THEIR STAY AT THE HOTEL THEY’VE BOOKED. SO COULD BE MONTHS LATER. 
THAT’S UNDERHAND, NOT TRANSPARENT &, I SUSPECT, BREAKS U.K. LAW. I’M TRYING TO FIND OUT VIA TRADING STANDARDS TO STOP THEM RIPPING OFF CUSTOMERS IN THIS WAY. 
SO UNLESS SUPER.COM CHANGE THEIR STANCE & FULFIL THE OFFER, BE AWARE EVERYONE - DON’T RELY ON THEIR OFFERS. THEY DON’T EVEN MAKE THE TERMS CLEAR IN THE SMALL PRINT COS THERE AREN’T ANY. A SCAM. VERY DEVIOUS

Title: SuperTravel discriminates and will be taken off our vendor list. BUYER BEWARE
Details: I have cancer. I had booked a weekend away using this company, as it was on our vendors list, and wanted to try them out. Not 20 minutes later I got a call from my oncologist stating they had a last minute cancellation to get my surgery done the following day. I booked a weekend. In less than an hour I tried to cancel my booking but the agent wanted proof. I submitted my original doctor's note I handed to work explain my stage 2 cancer, a new note explaining my upcoming surgery for Saturday, and even forced to send a picture of myself. They wanted official documents from the surgeon, which you do not get until your day of admission at the hopsital. I have never used supertravel before and shelling out 340 dollars, is something I cannot afford to just give up. I had no choice but to pass the surgery and wait for my actual surgery date which is in June. I was so upset. It was like they didn't care at all. Now.my weekend staycation ( as i cannot travel far at the moment) , is a bust. I have feelings of remorse. I'm really upset at how they treated me. I submitted actual formal Dr. notes from my oncologist but they said that was not good enough. I sent a picture of myself showing my bald head from my chemo and they still did not believe me. I sent my Last picture of my hospital band of last week showing I was in the cancer ward for my chemo and not good enough. These people truly do not care about customer care or service. I will never EVER USE THEM AGAIN. I will make sure to let everyone know from my work, FlightCentre, to take them off of our vendor list. I was told that it would be no problem to get a refund if I submit a doctor's note showing I have surgery which I did. Confirmation booking id: B_9609607. May 26 to May 28.

Title: Another botched hotel booking with no customer support
Details:
I am now being ignored by SuperTravel's customer support after multiple attempts to contact them by phone and email.  On April 29, 2023 SuperTravel botched my hotel booking causing me to pay out of pocket for a similar room type at another hotel.  As a final resort, I am now working with my credit card company to dispute the payment I made with SuperTravel for the room I never got!  
This is the second time I have had an issue with SuperTravel.  Below is a detailed account of what happened and the lack of response from SuperTravel.

I reserved and paid extra for a one-bedroom suite at the Hyatt House in King of Prussia, PA so I could have separate sleeping areas for my family.  Upon checking in at the hotel, I was told they did not have a one-bedroom suite available and could only offer a studio suite.  I refused to accept this room because it was not able to accommodate my family needs in addition to being a downgrade from the room I had prepaid for.  
I immediately called Super Travel's support line from the hotel lobby to see if they could help resolve the issue.  After a long hold, I finally spoke with a representative who took my information and said I would get a call back from a specialist in 20 minutes.  After 40 minutes of waiting, I called back again and got into the long call queue to speak with a representative.  When I finally did get connected, I was told that a case was already opened and that I would get a callback in 10 to 15 minutes by a specialist.  
At this point it was now getting late and my young son was getting anxious and worried that we would not have a place to stay as we waited for over an hour in the hotel lobby for SuperTravel to respond.  I went back to the front desk staff at the Hyatt House and asked them if I could speak with the manager on duty to see if there was anything they could do from their end.  I was told that Courtney Quinn, Director of Guest Services at the Hyatt House, was aware of the situation and reiterated there was nothing they could do other than cancel the reservation without penalty because the room I booked was not available. I agreed to them canceling my reservation without penalty.  I also asked for written confirmation that it was canceled.  The Hyatt House staff refused to put anything in writing about the cancellation or room type being unavailable.  They kept telling me to have the booking company contact them, which I said I tried multiple times to contact them and was still waiting for them to respond to me.  
My patience was now wearing thin.  I had waited more than the time stated for a callback after the second call to SuperTravel.  This was now over an hour and a half since we initially tried to check into the room I reserved with SuperTravel.  I finally gave up standing with my family in the lobby for SuperTravel to call me back and found another hotel 15 minutes away that had a similar one-bedroom suite available.
Shortly after checking into the other hotel, I finally received a call back from a SuperTravel specialist (almost 2 hours after I initially made contact).  I informed the agent that I was now checked into another hotel and paid out of pocket more than my original booking.  I was told that they were really sorry that I had to take matters into my own hands and that they would resolve the issue if I emailed the new hotel booking receipt to travelsupport with my booking id.  
The next day, I sent an email to travelsupport with a brief recap of what happened along with my hotel invoice for the hotel I paid out of pocket for.  Three minutes later I got a response from Jannah at SuperTravel requesting me to provide written confirmation from the Hotel Front Desk that I was not able to use the booking, and why. I attempted to respond multiple times to SuperTravel support and each time I got an automated response stating that my ticket with the team has been marked as closed.  Two days later, I sent a new email in an attempt to reconnect and never got a response.  I then called multiple times the support line (844) 461-2577 and each time the recording stated there was a long wait to speak with a representative.  On each separate call, I requested a callback which I never got!  
This has been such a waste of my time!  The booking would have only been $30 more had I booked directly with the hotel or another travel website.  I have now spent many frustrating hours of my time trying to resolve this issue.  In the long run, the aggravation this has caused is not worth any of the savings I have realized by using SuperTravel in the past. 
Think twice before you use SuperTravel and be forewarned there is absolutely no support when you need it!

Title: They will not help you even when it's their fault
Details:
I contacted Super Travel three times for issues with my booking just to be met with either extra charges or just flat out refusal to help.
The first time I needed to update a small detail on my booking (probably something I could have just called the hotel for) and they were going to charge $15 to do that. Pass.
The second time was when we found bed bugs in the hotel room and the hotel manager closed the office early. Super Travel told me I had to talk to the manager and refused to help me further. The next day the manager got our message and said he initiated a refund through Expedia, who I guess they partnered with for my booking.
The third time was when I tried to confirm the refund as I hadn't seen anything in my accounts or email about it. They told me I had to submit a bunch of documentation for them to process it, despite the hotel manager already doing that. The customer service agent continually told me that they couldn't do a thing until I personally (not Expedia) submitted the documentation. He refused to answer why they didn't have access to what was already there, and then ended the chat before I got the answers I needed. 

HARD PASS ON THIS COMPANY. Not worth the lower prices they will NOT HELP YOU when you need it.

Details:

A few mins after receiving the confirmation, i contacted Super Travel support to advise of the mistake and find out if there was anything at all they could do. Super Travel support kept repeating same thing..."cannot change or cancel - non refundable booking". 

I also immediately contacted the hotel direct to advise of the error. They took note and advised me to cancel through Super Travel. I also emailed the hotel who responded advising if Super Travel sent through a date change request, they would accept the request at no charge. 
I contacted Super Travel support again, who reminded me "Booking non refundable - cannot be changed or cancelled".

I appreciate my mistake and the terms & conditions of the booking, but i was really hoping for some customer service or goodwill here. I have booked with Super Travel previously, but will never use them again.

Update on 23 May 2023: Provided Super Travel with my details as per their response to the review on this site, but they still have not responded.

Title: Terrible first time buying experience
Details:
Terrible first time buying experience.  
I bought a Harman Kardon Speaker and everything from communication to shipping went smoothly until the item arrived. I was worried about all the negative reviews, but I thought Ill give it a try and see for myself. 
Stay away would be my advice  !!!! 
The speaker appears to be new in original, but opened box and it came with 3 international charging cables for Europe, Australia and Japan but the US charger cable is not included. The listing made no reference to that. 
I contacted customer service for options to remedy the fact that I cannot charge the speaker and received a prompt response advising me that the problem is now mine, not theirs.    
I was advised that they don't have any and that I should go out and find and then buy a cable that will work. 
Ticket closed ! 
I will return the item and hopefully the next buyer has a charger and cable in reserve before they buy the recycled crap. 
Definitely cannot recommend this seller. Stay away !!

Title: I booked an Hotel Holidays In Mark…
Details:
I booked an hotel Holidays In Mark center, Alexandria, va. Dates should be 4/26--4/29. When I received an email from Super travels they booked my room for September dates. Tried to call and send an emails to changed dates or cancel my booking. Unable to reach by an email or live person. Ask for refund my card. Unable to reach to live agents. I end up booking myself direct calling hotel and booked hotel room myself and paid. Supertravel didn'trefund  my money. I will  not use this scammer website and let others know not to use or waste your money..I called and spoke with rep. about 2 weeks before staying at the hotel. Title: Just don't
Details:
Just don't. The company advertises super low rates to get your CC info and then all bets are off. I tried to book in Flagstaff, AZ but got a confirmation about a  hotel in India, with a bunch of language about it being non-refundable. I was able to cancel it out but I've called the Flagstaff hotel and they have zero record of my booking. Don't bother, it's  a sketchy scam company and they have a zero refund policy.

ETA: Yes I did contact the chat bot to try and ensure that everything was cancelled when I received a confirmation for a hotel in INDIA. Since I only paid $23 for the booking I was fine not being refunded for the reservation but I wanted to ensure I wouldn't be charged anything for a cancellation or a no-show for a hotel in INDIA and I wanted to be sure I had nothing on the books for anything at all in Flagstaff anyway. The hotel in India was kind enough to send me a confirmation of the cancellation and the refund of my $23 but every time I called the Arizona hotel they said they had no record of me (which was reassuring but shows that nothing was handled correctly to begin with). Not even sure what went wrong with this transaction but my advice would just be to book directly with the hotel or a reputable booking company in the future.

Title: I will never book through Super Travel…
Details: I will never book through Super Travel again. Their customer service is terrible. I booked two rooms in January 2023. I was provided with a confirmation number from the hotel for one of the rooms in February, but they did not have confirmation for the second room. The hotel assured me that they should have gotten both room requests from Super Travel and that the issue needed to be resolved through them. Super Travel blamed the hotel for not opening rooms for third party reservations until closer to the check in date, which made no sense because one of the rooms was confirmed. I got nothing but runaround and scripted answers from Super Travel for 4 months. Plus, my calls would be put in a queue and it would be hours before you reached an agent, then calls would be abruptly disconnected for no reason. Do yourself a favor and don't use this company.

Title: NOT delivered & NO REFUND
Details: I purchased $66 worth of merchandise from SuperShop only to have it sent by FEDEX who said it was delivered but did not deliver. Since SuperShop uses econo-FEDEX then they must initiate claim. Instead of doing so they trying to close my case without a refund. No delivery picture and I cannot file the claim. Please know that even though they say your complaint is being investigated - they do not. This company is a scam.

Title: This company is straight up not legit
Details:
This company is straight up not legit.  I booked a hotel room for my son and grandson who has cancer - purchased the additional cancellation policy, knowing that due to chemo treatments, he often times gets quite ill.  Several days prior to this reservation, he got sick so I called to cancel even BEFORE the reservation.  Filled out the required Super Travel cancellation forms and then?  Crickets.....nothing.  I have called, emailed, and chatted - explaining the simple story over and over and over again.  Each time the rep promised to help and that the refund was in process.  Well here I sit 4 weeks later - nothing.  They do not respond well to emails and the chats are all responses being read from a script - I am just now back on chat and once they found out that I am looking for me refund - they disconnected and will not respond.  DO NOT use this company - 100% sham.

UPDATE 5/11 As you can see the company reached out below acting as if they are going to assist (as they normally do) and once again, I submitted my cancellation reference number and repeated why I had to cancel...crickets!  No change to my original review.

5/17/2023
I received an email simply stating my ticket has been closed and they will no longer monitor my responses.  The response they post below is a straight-out untruth.  I filled out the required forms the day I canceled and asked numerous times (probably 15 emails/chat) if they had what they needed in order to process.  Again, just talked in circles with the same word tracks over and over and over again, never giving me any answers to my questions.  All I wanted to know is if they received what they needed (they did - it's a online form) and when my refund would be processed.  I would think a child with cancer would be an accepted reason for canceling a reervation and the whole reason I purchased the additional insurance.  But this company will do whatever they can do to avoid paying out.  I will never ever again go through a 3rd party to book a lodging stay - go through the hotel directly!  All in all I lost about $250.  Horrible service.
